noun.description: Silk fabric that has been subjected to heat and pressure rollers after weaving to give it a rippled appearance.
examples: a backless dress fashioned out of moire in the new fashionable color
many brocades and moires have a high acetate content

adjective.description: (of silk) having a rippled, lustrous finish.

origin: Mid 17th century: French moire mohair (the original fabric); the variant moiré given a watered appearance (past participle of moirer, from moire).
